tor","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"maliciousValidator","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"blockNumber","type":"uint256"}],"name":"ReportedMalicious","type":"event"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.","methods":{"areDelegatorsBanned(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether delegators of the specified pool are currently banned. A validator pool can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` function).","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the pool."}},"clearUnremovableValidator()":{"details":"Makes the non-removable validator removable. Can only be called by the staking address of the non-removable validator or by the `owner`."},"emitInitiateChange()":{"details":"Emits the `InitiateChange` event to pass a new validator set to the validator nodes. Called automatically by one of the current validator's nodes when the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter returns `true` (when some validator needs to be removed as malicious or the validator set needs to be updated at the beginning of a new staking epoch). The new validator set is passed to the validator nodes through the `InitiateChange` event and saved for later use by the `finalizeChange` function. See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html for more info about the `InitiateChange` event."},"emitInitiateChangeCallable()":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` function can be called at the moment. Used by a validator's node and `TxPermission` contract (to deny dummy calling)."},"finalizeChange()":{"details":"Called by the system when an initiated validator set change reaches finality and is activated. This function is called at the beginning of a block (before all the block transactions). Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). Stores a new validator set saved before by the `emitInitiateChange` function and passed through the `InitiateChange` event. After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set. If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function, an old validator set is also stored and can be read by the `getPreviousValidators` getter. The `finalizeChange` is only called once for each `InitiateChange` event emitted. The next `InitiateChange` event is not emitted until the previous one is not yet finalized by the `finalizeChange` (see the code of `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter)."},"getPendingValidators()":{"details":"Returns the current array of validators which should be passed to the `InitiateChange` event. The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function. Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all validator nodes."},"getPreviousValidators()":{"details":"Returns the previous validator set (validators' mining addresses array). The array is stored by the `finalizeChange` function when a new staking epoch's validator set is finalized."},"getValidators()":{"details":"Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses) which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node."},"initialize(address,address,address,address[],address[],bool)":{"details":"Initializes the network parameters. Used by the constructor of the `InitializerAuRa` contract.","params":{"_blockRewardContract":"The address of the `BlockRewardAuRa` contract.","_firstValidatorIsUnremovable":"The boolean flag defining whether the first validator in the `_initialMiningAddresses/_initialStakingAddresses` array is non-removable. Should be `false` for a production network.","_initialMiningAddresses":"The array of initial validators' mining addresses.","_initialStakingAddresses":"The array of initial validators' staking addresses.","_randomContract":"The address of the `RandomAuRa` contract.","_stakingContract":"The address of the `StakingAuRa` contract."}},"initiateChangeAllowed()":{"details":"A boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` can be called at the moment. Used by the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter. This flag is set to `false` by the `emitInitiateChange` and set to `true` by the `finalizeChange` function. When the `InitiateChange` event is emitted by `emitInitiateChange`, the next `emitInitiateChange` call is not possible until the validator set from the previous call is finalized by the `finalizeChange` function."},"isInitialized()":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called."},"isReportValidatorValid(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address) is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address) can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious` function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The validator's mining address."}},"isValidatorBanned(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is currently banned. A validator can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function).","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address."}},"isValidatorOrPending(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is a validator or is in the `_pendingValidators` or `_finalizeValidators` array. Used by the `StakingAuRa.maxWithdrawAllowed` and `StakingAuRa.maxWithdrawOrderAllowed` getters.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address."}},"maliceReportedForBlock(address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns an array of the validators (their mining addresses) which reported that the specified malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number.","_miningAddress":"The mining address of malicious validator."}},"newValidatorSet()":{"details":"Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract. Automatically called by the `BlockRewardAuRa.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch."},"removeMaliciousValidators(address[])":{"details":"Removes malicious validators. Called by the `RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound` function.","params":{"_miningAddresses":"The mining addresses of the malicious validators."}},"reportMalicious(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Reports that the malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block. Called by the node of each honest validator after the specified validator misbehaved. See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html#reporting-contract Can only be called when the `reportMaliciousCallable` getter returns `true`.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number where the misbehavior was observed.","_maliciousMiningAddress":"The mining address of the malicious validator."}},"reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called by the specified validator with the given parameters. Used by the `reportMalicious` function and `TxPermission` contract. Also, returns a boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting during the current staking epoch.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.","_maliciousMiningAddress":"The mining address of the malicious validator which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.","_reportingMiningAddress":"The mining address of the reporting validator which is calling the `reportMalicious` function."},"return":"`bool callable` - The boolean flag indicating whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called at the moment. `bool removeReportingValidator` - The boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting. This flag is only used by the `reportMalicious` function."},"setStakingAddress(address,address)":{"details":"Binds a mining address to the specified staking address. Called by the `StakingAuRa.addPool` function when a user wants to become a candidate and creates a pool. See also the `miningByStakingAddress` and `stakingByMiningAddress` public mappings.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_stakingAddress` and should never be used as a pool before.","_stakingAddress":"The staking address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_miningAddress` and should never be used as a pool before."}},"shouldValidatorReport(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Only used by Ethereum client (see https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/11245). Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator should report about some validator's misbehaviour at the specified block.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number at which the validator misbehaved.","_maliciousMiningAddress":"The mining address of malicious validator.","_reportingMiningAddress":"The mining address of validator who reports."}},"validatorsToBeFinalized()":{"details":"Returns a validator set about to be finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.","params":{"forNewEpoch":"A boolean flag indicating whether the `miningAddresses` array was formed by the `newValidatorSet` function. The `finalizeChange` function logic depends on this flag.","miningAddresses":"An array set by the `emitInitiateChange` function."}}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/home/jack/prog/blkchn/velas/posdao-test-setup/posdao-contracts/contracts/ValidatorSetAuRa.sol":"ValidatorSetAuRa"},"evmVersion":"constantinople","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/home/jack/prog/blkchn/velas/posdao-test-setup/posdao-contracts/contracts/ValidatorSetAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1d291ba9bc4fc744393b0887f27655a2f5bd33030ce4f7cfbc995a605ef7b3fe","urls":["bzzr://378f529bbb6ade191e31c28da7672b4a3632978fd27d6ab66d84550e67378fc8","dweb:/ipfs/QmU8ZSoeC7KoWzmc3Foge1bvTaYxXX1AnXWbyTRwLtCv1g"]},"/home/jack/prog/blkchn/velas/posdao-test-setup/posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IBlockRewardAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3530f79ac6d8930c178acf7d32de59414f248f2e619fb4085e6f7030c3c5d5d7","urls":["bzzr://ea94e03a9f9ca0f241de1bf1fa6ca536ea986c9fe0f8cb5016bf1f13f2b63a54","dweb:/ipfs/QmPR1ihVpddDeXszWr6CPPsapkUo5A6kFQZnEQEQ3mnUMX"]},"/home/jack/prog/blkchn/velas/posdao-test-setup/posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IRandomAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3fb715003f6e7959f4222db647cac4cdbc5f3f7dd02f677328f530000a6a4e8c","urls":["bzzr://8cf84328ca0c59648539dbde37d3cca24b67786fb1ec087e6ac0de655263fa03","dweb:/ipfs/QmP6pkL2wAFAhnogAme1jGfrGTR6Ta7ZsPXpkTTp8ceYaq"]},"/home/jack/prog/blkchn/velas/posdao-test-setup/posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IStakingAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe69175ee9319baa887e53155e52d1bca27dd4d9374c17401ab33fce6f52d6b60","urls":["bzzr://12ea6b04011d3f37f045ef800627da98b5fbc2b50521e348f7387b17923908fb","dweb:/ipfs/QmRriH2iqdTHPAXib3KxdxoPPwbpJr9nwPPUf16dDa4rZ9"]},"/home/jack/prog/blkchn/velas/posdao-test-setup/posdao-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IValidatorSetAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9c28594d6c895b94d826ed212a6eb3bc316e0fcdd6556ab1295f24661d5cd34d","urls":["bzzr://290d129087298867a300afae0552380e0ff7c08c0400c737c3f46b334fca4728","dweb:/ipfs/QmU8t9QZ5yMTgN4AB9jdqQaca9mUpG5umDEG3RBJn7q9ou"]},"/home/jack/prog/blkchn/velas/posdao-test-set nodes.documentation:
@dev Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators
 before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.
nodes.name: ValidatorSetAuRa
InitiateChange
ReportedMalicious

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the `initialize` function was called before.
nodes.name: onlyInitialized

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the caller is the BlockRewardAuRa contract address.
nodes.name: onlyBlockRewardContract

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the caller is the RandomAuRa contract address.
nodes.name: onlyRandomContract

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the caller is the StakingAuRa contract address.
nodes.name: onlyStakingContract

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the caller is the SYSTEM_ADDRESS. See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html
nodes.name: onlySystem

nodes.documentation:
@dev Makes the non-removable validator removable. Can only be called by the staking address of the
 non-removable validator or by the `owner`.
nodes.name: clearUnremovableValidator

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emits the `InitiateChange` event to pass a new validator set to the validator nodes.
 Called automatically by one of the current validator's nodes when the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter
 returns `true` (when some validator needs to be removed as malicious or the validator set needs to be
 updated at the beginning of a new staking epoch). The new validator set is passed to the validator nodes
 through the `InitiateChange` event and saved for later use by the `finalizeChange` function.
 See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html for more info about the `InitiateChange` event.
nodes.name: emitInitiateChange

nodes.documentation:
@dev Called by the system when an initiated validator set change reaches finality and is activated.
 This function is called at the beginning of a block (before all the block transactions).
 Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). Stores a new validator set saved
 before by the `emitInitiateChange` function and passed through the `InitiateChange` event.
 After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set.
 If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function,
 an old validator set is also stored and can be read by the `getPreviousValidators` getter.
 The `finalizeChange` is only called once for each `InitiateChange` event emitted. The next `InitiateChange`
 event is not emitted until the previous one is not yet finalized by the `finalizeChange`
 (see the code of `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter).
nodes.name: finalizeChange
initialize

nodes.documentation:
@dev Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools
 is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and
 stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.
 Automatically called by the `BlockRewardAuRa.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch.
nodes.name: newValidatorSet

nodes.documentation:
@dev Removes malicious validators. Called by the `RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound` function.
 @param _miningAddresses The mining addresses of the malicious validators.
nodes.name: removeMaliciousValidators
reportMalicious
setStakingAddress
areDelegatorsBanned

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` function can be called
 at the moment. Used by a validator's node and `TxPermission` contract (to deny dummy calling).
nodes.name: emitInitiateChangeCallable
getPreviousValidators

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the current array of validators which should be passed to the `InitiateChange` event.
 The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious
 or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function.
 Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then
 used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all
 validator nodes.
nodes.name: getPendingValidators

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses)
 which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node.
nodes.name: getValidators

nodes.documentation:
@dev A boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` can be called at the moment.
 Used by the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter. This flag is set to `false` by the `emitInitiateChange`
 and set to `true` by the `finalizeChange` function. When the `InitiateChange` event is emitted by
 `emitInitiateChange`, the next `emitInitiateChange` call is not possible until the validator set from
 the previous call is finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.
nodes.name: initiateChangeAllowed

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called.
nodes.name: isInitialized

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address)
 is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address)
 can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious`
 function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a
 validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the
 engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.
 @param _miningAddress The validator's mining address.
nodes.name: isReportValidatorValid
isValidatorBanned
isValidatorOrPending
maliceReportedForBlock
reportMaliciousCallable
shouldValidatorReport
validatorsToBeFinalized
_clearReportingCounter
_finalizeNewValidators
_setPendingValidatorsChanged

nodes.documentation:
@dev Marks the pending validator set as unchanged before passing it to the `InitiateChange` event
 (and then to the `finalizeChange` function). Called by the `emitInitiateChange` function.
nodes.name: _unsetPendingValidatorsChanged
_incrementReportingCounter
_removeMaliciousValidator
_removeMaliciousValidators

nodes.documentation: @dev Stores previous validators. Used by the `finalizeChange` function.
nodes.name: _savePreviousValidators
_setPendingValidators
_setStakingAddress

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the future block number until which a validator is banned.
 Used by the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function.
nodes.name: _banUntil

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the current block number. Needed mostly for unit tests.
nodes.name: _getCurrentBlockNumber
_getRandomIndex

@dev Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators
 before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.

nodes.name: onlySystem

nodes.documentation:
@dev Makes the non-removable validator removable. Can only be called by the staking address of the
 non-removable validator or by the `owner`.
nodes.name: clearUnremovableValidator

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emits the `InitiateChange` event to pass a new validator set to the validator nodes.
 Called automatically by one of the current validator's nodes when the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter
 returns `true` (when some validator needs to be removed as malicious or the validator set needs to be
 updated at the beginning of a new staking epoch). The new validator set is passed to the validator nodes
 through the `InitiateChange` event and saved for later use by the `finalizeChange` function.
 See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html for more info about the `InitiateChange` event.
nodes.name: emitInitiateChange

nodes.documentation:
@dev Called by the system when an initiated validator set change reaches finality and is activated.
 This function is called at the beginning of a block (before all the block transactions).
 Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). Stores a new validator set saved
 before by the `emitInitiateChange` function and passed through the `InitiateChange` event.
 After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set.
 If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function,
 an old validator set is also stored and can be read by the `getPreviousValidators` getter.
 The `finalizeChange` is only called once for each `InitiateChange` event emitted. The next `InitiateChange`
 event is not emitted until the previous one is not yet finalized by the `finalizeChange`
 (see the code of `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter).
nodes.name: finalizeChange
initialize

nodes.documentation:
@dev Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools
 is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and
 stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.
 Automatically called by the `BlockRewardAuRa.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch.
nodes.name: newValidatorSet

nodes.documentation:
@dev Removes malicious validators. Called by the `RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound` function.
 @param _miningAddresses The mining addresses of the malicious validators.
nodes.name: removeMaliciousValidators
reportMalicious
setStakingAddress
areDelegatorsBanned

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` function can be called
 at the moment. Used by a validator's node and `TxPermission` contract (to deny dummy calling).
nodes.name: emitInitiateChangeCallable
getPreviousValidators

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the current array of validators which should be passed to the `InitiateChange` event.
 The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious
 or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function.
 Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then
 used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all
 validator nodes.
nodes.name: getPendingValidators

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses)
 which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node.
nodes.name: getValidators

nodes.documentation:
@dev A boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` can be called at the moment.
 Used by the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter. This flag is set to `false` by the `emitInitiateChange`
 and set to `true` by the `finalizeChange` function. When the `InitiateChange` event is emitted by
 `emitInitiateChange`, the next `emitInitiateChange` call is not possible until the validator set from
 the previous call is finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.
nodes.name: initiateChangeAllowed

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called.
nodes.name: isInitialized

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address)
 is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address)
 can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious`
 function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a
 validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the
 engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.
 @param _miningAddress The validator's mining address.
nodes.name: isReportValidatorValid
isValidatorBanned
isValidatorOrPending
maliceReportedForBlock
reportMaliciousCallable
shouldValidatorReport
validatorsToBeFinalized

_finalizeNewValidators
_setPendingValidatorsChanged

nodes.documentation:
@dev Marks the pending validator set as unchanged before passing it to the `InitiateChange` event
 (and then to the `finalizeChange` function). Called by the `emitInitiateChange` function.
nodes.name: _unsetPendingValidatorsChanged
_incrementReportingCounter
_removeMaliciousValidator
_removeMaliciousValidators

nodes.documentation: @dev Stores previous validators. Used by the `finalizeChange` function.
nodes.name: _savePreviousValidators
_setPendingValidators
_setStakingAddress

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the future block number until which a validator is banned.
 Used by the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function.
nodes.name: _banUntil

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the current block number. Needed mostly for unit tests.
nodes.name: _getCurrentBlockNumber
_getRandomIndex

devdoc.details: Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.

areDelegatorsBanned(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether delegators of the specified pool are currently banned. A validator pool can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` function).

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the pool.

clearUnremovableValidator().details: Makes the non-removable validator removable. Can only be called by the staking address of the non-removable validator or by the `owner`.

emitInitiateChange().details: Emits the `InitiateChange` event to pass a new validator set to the validator nodes. Called automatically by one of the current validator's nodes when the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter returns `true` (when some validator needs to be removed as malicious or the validator set needs to be updated at the beginning of a new staking epoch). The new validator set is passed to the validator nodes through the `InitiateChange` event and saved for later use by the `finalizeChange` function. See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html for more info about the `InitiateChange` event.

emitInitiateChangeCallable().details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` function can be called at the moment. Used by a validator's node and `TxPermission` contract (to deny dummy calling).

finalizeChange().details: Called by the system when an initiated validator set change reaches finality and is activated. This function is called at the beginning of a block (before all the block transactions). Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). Stores a new validator set saved before by the `emitInitiateChange` function and passed through the `InitiateChange` event. After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set. If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function, an old validator set is also stored and can be read by the `getPreviousValidators` getter. The `finalizeChange` is only called once for each `InitiateChange` event emitted. The next `InitiateChange` event is not emitted until the previous one is not yet finalized by the `finalizeChange` (see the code of `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter).

getPendingValidators().details: Returns the current array of validators which should be passed to the `InitiateChange` event. The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function. Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all validator nodes.

getPreviousValidators().details: Returns the previous validator set (validators' mining addresses array). The array is stored by the `finalizeChange` function when a new staking epoch's validator set is finalized.

getValidators().details: Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses) which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: Initializes the network parameters. Used by the constructor of the `InitializerAuRa` contract.

params._firstValidatorIsUnremovable: The boolean flag defining whether the first validator in the `_initialMiningAddresses/_initialStakingAddresses` array is non-removable. Should be `false` for a production network.
params._initialMiningAddresses: The array of initial validators' mining addresses.
params._initialStakingAddresses: The array of initial validators' staking addresses.

initiateChangeAllowed().details: A boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` can be called at the moment. Used by the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter. This flag is set to `false` by the `emitInitiateChange` and set to `true` by the `finalizeChange` function. When the `InitiateChange` event is emitted by `emitInitiateChange`, the next `emitInitiateChange` call is not possible until the validator set from the previous call is finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.

isInitialized().details: Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called.

isReportValidatorValid(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address) is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address) can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious` function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.

isValidatorBanned(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is currently banned. A validator can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function).

isValidatorOrPending(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is a validator or is in the `_pendingValidators` or `_finalizeValidators` array. Used by the `StakingAuRa.maxWithdrawAllowed` and `StakingAuRa.maxWithdrawOrderAllowed` getters.

maliceReportedForBlock(address,uint256).details: Returns an array of the validators (their mining addresses) which reported that the specified malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of malicious validator.

newValidatorSet().details: Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract. Automatically called by the `BlockRewardAuRa.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch.

removeMaliciousValidators(address[]).details: Removes malicious validators. Called by the `RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound` function.

params._miningAddresses: The mining addresses of the malicious validators.

reportMalicious(address,uint256,bytes).details: Reports that the malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block. Called by the node of each honest validator after the specified validator misbehaved. See https://wiki.parity.io/Validator-Set.html#reporting-contract Can only be called when the `reportMaliciousCallable` getter returns `true`.

params._blockNumber: The block number where the misbehavior was observed.
params._maliciousMiningAddress: The mining address of the malicious validator.

reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,.details: Returns whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called by the specified validator with the given parameters. Used by the `reportMalicious` function and `TxPermission` contract. Also, returns a boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting during the current staking epoch.

params._blockNumber: The block number which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.
params._maliciousMiningAddress: The mining address of the malicious validator which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.
params._reportingMiningAddress: The mining address of the reporting validator which is calling the `reportMalicious` function.

reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,.return: `bool callable` - The boolean flag indicating whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called at the moment. `bool removeReportingValidator` - The boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting. This flag is only used by the `reportMalicious` function.

setStakingAddress(address,address).details: Binds a mining address to the specified staking address. Called by the `StakingAuRa.addPool` function when a user wants to become a candidate and creates a pool. See also the `miningByStakingAddress` and `stakingByMiningAddress` public mappings.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_stakingAddress` and should never be used as a pool before.
params._stakingAddress: The staking address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_miningAddress` and should never be used as a pool before.

shouldValidatorReport(address,address,ui.details: Only used by Ethereum client (see https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/11245). Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator should report about some validator's misbehaviour at the specified block.

params._blockNumber: The block number at which the validator misbehaved.
params._maliciousMiningAddress: The mining address of malicious validator.
params._reportingMiningAddress: The mining address of validator who reports.

validatorsToBeFinalized().details: Returns a validator set about to be finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.

params.forNewEpoch: A boolean flag indicating whether the `miningAddresses` array was formed by the `newValidatorSet` function. The `finalizeChange` function logic depends on this flag.
params.miningAddresses: An array set by the `emitInitiateChange` function.
